title: Judith Godrèche to the French film industry: 'I'm talking but I can't hear you'
summary: The French actress spoke out during the Césars ceremony on Friday evening, calling on the 'peculiar family' of French cinema to 'say out loud' what is really going on with sexual and gender-based violence in the industry.

title: War in Gaza: The anger of Detroit's Arab Americans
summary: Michigan's largest city and its outskirts are home to a multitude of individuals from Lebanon, Palestine, Yemen, Iraq, Afghanistan and Syria, united around the Palestinian cause. The widely-read local newspaper, 'The Arab American News,' which supported the Democrats in 2020, is this time calling for a break with Joe Biden.

title: Tractors enter Paris as farmers increase pressure on Macron ahead of agriculture show
summary: Around 30 tractors entered central Paris heading for Les Invalides, the military museum and esplanade just across the river from the Elysée presidential palace.

title: United States strengthens its arsenal of sanctions against Russia
summary: Two years into the war in Ukraine, the White House has announced sanctions on 500 new Russian individuals or companies, along with 26 entities and individuals across 11 countries for aiding in circumventing earlier sanctions.

title: Israeli PM Netanyahu proposes post-war Gaza plan
summary: Netanyahu's plan calls for Palestinian 'local officials' without Hamas ties to govern Gaza after the war. It has been rejected by both Palestinian Hamas and Fatah parties, and clashes with US visions of post-war Gaza.

title: Stellantis CEO's compensation reaches €36.5 million for 2023
summary: In one working day, the CEO earns what an average Stellantis employee earns in a year. He is paid almost six times more than Toyota's CEO, but far less than the American heads of those top 20 global companies Stellantis aims to match.

title: NRA chief Wayne LaPierre found liable for financial misconduct
summary: A New York jury found that Wayne LaPierre misused millions of the National Rifle Association funds for personal use, including luxury travel, private jets, and superyachts.

title: Dengue fever vaccinations are making headway
summary: The French National Health Authority plans to publish guidelines on the Japanese Qdenga vaccine in June, while the Butantan Institute in Brazil advances its research. It's a 'new era' in the fight against dengue fever.

title: War in Ukraine: French companies grapple with leaving Russia
summary: Some multinationals were plundered after their hasty withdrawal, some pretend they have left and others try to justify the fact that they're still operating in Russia.

title: Can Ukraine still win? Why the outcome of the war depends on ammunition
summary: Two years after Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24, 2022, Ukraine's frontline has nearly been frozen.

title: James Webb Telescope sheds light on the origin of water on Earth
summary: In a young solar system at the heart of the Orion Nebula, an international team has spotted a molecule indicative of the chemical transformation of water.

title: German parliament votes to legalize cannabis possession
summary: Under the new law, which will go into effect in April, it will be possible to obtain up to 25 grams of the drug per day for personal use through regulated cannabis cultivation associations and have up to three plants at home.

title: Gaza is starving after four and a half months of siege by the Israeli army
summary: The destruction of sewage systems and the crowding of displaced persons in the south have led to fears of the spread of disease.

title: The apartheid skeletons in the closets of Comoros' legendary Galawa Beach Hotel
summary: This 5-star establishment, which was destroyed in 2007, was closely linked to the South African apartheid regime. Today, an Egyptian group is rebuilding it to revive local tourism in the Indian Ocean archipelago.

title: 2024 Césars film awards: The full list of nominees
summary: The 49th ceremony honoring French cinema is taking place on Friday evening in Paris. 'Le Règne animal' and 'Anatomie d'une chute' have the most nominations.

title: Eiffel Tower to remain closed Saturday morning, unions say
summary: Staff voted to extend the strike over the monument's management and what unions say is insufficient investment.

title: The story behind Vittrup man, a migrant killed in Denmark 3,000 years ago
summary: Analysis of a crushed skull found in a peat bog over a century ago suggests that the individual had spent his childhood in the Scandinavian peninsula before his life brutally ended among Bronze Age farmers.

title: A French ski resort is focusing on indoor and virtual skiing to attract new customers
summary: While the French Court of Auditors has just criticized French ski resorts for being too reliant on downhill skiing, the Hautes-Alpes resort of Les Orres is banking on diversifying its activities.

title: Ksenia Karelina, a Russian-American accused of high treason in Russia over a $50 donation
summary: Several Westerners are currently detained in Russia. President Vladimir Putin recently mentioned the possibility of exchanging of one these detainees for an FSB killer currently imprisoned in Germany.

title: India dreams of replacing China as the world's factory
summary: The country is attracting a growing share of smartphone production, but its structural weaknesses, such as poverty, are an obstacle.

title: Tunisia: Former president Moncef Marzouki sentenced to eight years in prison
summary: Marzouki, 78, Tunisia's first democratically elected head of state after the country's 2011 Arab Spring revolution, was found guilty of 'provoking disorder' and 'inciting people to arms.'

title: The war in Ukraine began in 2014, not two years ago
summary: The large-scale invasion launched by Vladimir Putin on February 24, 2022, is just one element of the hybrid aggression initiated by Moscow 10 years earlier.

title: Looking back at one month of farmers' anger in France
summary: Since the first roadblock on January 17, the farmers' mobilization has gained momentum. Despite their unions' call to halt protests, some farmers plan to voice their concerns at the Paris International Agricultural Show on Saturday.

title: Césars 2024: 'Anatomy of a Fall' dominates, winning six trophies including best film
summary: France's main film honors on Friday night were eclipsed by actress Judith Godrèche, who called for greater awareness of sexist and sexual violence in French cinema.

title: Flaco, New York City's beloved owl, dies after striking a building
summary: The Eurasian eagle-owl became a social media star after he escaped Central Park Zoo over a year ago. His death was announced on Friday.

title: Chaos reigns as farmers clash with police at Paris's major agriculture fair
summary: Emmanuel Macron's arrival at the Salon de l'Agriculture in Paris on Saturday provoked an explosive reaction from angry farmers.

title: In South Carolina, Trump is gaining ground with college graduates
summary: With a new stage in the Republican primaries being held in this state on Saturday, Donald Trump is widely tipped as the favorite against Nikki Haley, the former governor, who remains determined to stay in the race.

title: Netanyahu unveils his post-war plan for Gaza
summary: The Israeli Prime Minister intends to maintain a military presence in the Gaza Strip. The Palestinian Authority rejected his plan as 'perpetuating the occupation,' while the US reiterated its rejection of a 'reoccupation' of Gaza.

title: French cinema: The end of impunity
summary: After powerful testimonials including that of actress Judith Godrèche, the pillars of French cinema have been shaken.  While this examination of conscience can rightly be considered overdue, it is all the more necessary and welcome.

title: Eiffel Tower set to reopen on Sunday
summary: After a five-day strike meant that tourists were not able to visit the Paris landmark, a deal has been reached with unions.

title: Navalny's body handed over to his mother
summary: For the past week, Russian authorities had refused to give Lyudmila Navalnaya custody of her son's body.

title: Zelensky vows triumph over Russia on second anniversary of war
summary: The Ukrainian president was speaking alongside the Canadian, Italian and Belgian prime ministers and EU Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen who came to Kyiv to mark the date.
